issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h6.Issue Description
We're trying to use a third party framework from Wowza to extend our application with video recording functionality. Release shows now be 64-bit compatible but upon module building works for armv7, i386, and arm64 but not x86_64. 

Architectures were added to manifest according [module development guide|http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/iOS_Module_64-bit_Support-section-43291229_iOSModule64-bitSupport-Modulebuildingforarmv7,i386,andarm64butnotx86_64]. 
{code}
$ xcrun lipo -info build/libcom.janx.wowza.a 
Architectures in the fat file: build/libcom.janx.wowza.a are: armv7 i386 x86_64 arm64 
{code}

h6.Stack Trace
{code}

h6.Steps to reproduce
1) Get module attached and extract it 
2) Run ./build.py
3) Unzip generated module put into app/modules/iphone/ 
4) Run sample app having attached the module
5) Notice stack trace
fields.summary: iOS: Support Dynamic Libraries for module development
fields.environment:
Node.js Version            = 0.12.7
npm Version                 = 2.11.3
Titanium CLI Version    = 5.0.5
node-appc Version       = 0.2.31
Titanium SDK 5.1.2.GA & 5.1.1.GA
Xcode 7.2.1 (build 7C1002)

comments.body: Note that the above stack trace is derived from building an app integrated with the packaged module. calling build.py works fine. Appreciate if [~egomez] you could include steps to reproduce. it'll be easier for QE to test as well if there's a fix for this.
Sure thing, just added the steps to reproduce [~cng], maybe libcom.janx.wowza.a its missing 64bit symbols even though shows as valid architecture.

Hey guys. Maybe this can help you figure out what's going on: this video was posted by a guy asking for help on a very similar issue 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHyqdg33sHw

There is still an issue with this framework. This is a dynamic framework, in order to link it, you must add it to the "Embed Frameworks" section in the Xcode project. I'm looking for the compiler flag and see how we can do it without having to modify the Xcode project.
This is fixed and extended with additional handling like script-phases to strip fat frameworks, see [this repo|https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/hook-embedded-frameworks] for more infos.
